name: Garlic Pork Fried Rice
description: My NEW fried rice obsession… it’s garlicky, porky and features one ingredient you might not be expecting…
keywords: 30-minute meals, Dinner, Easy weeknight dinners, Fried rice, Lunch, Pork, Rice, Rice bowls, Serves 2
recipeIngredient: 3 tbsp Chinese garlic chilli paste or sambal oelek
1 small tomato, cut into large wedges
finely sliced spring onion (scallions), to serve

recipeInstructions.text: 1.Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add the pork mince and spread it out in the pan. Allow to sear for at least 5 minutes or until deeply golden and crusty. Then break up the pork and add the onion and garlic. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes or until the onion has softened.

2.Add the chili paste and stir-fry until well combined. Now add the tomato and stir-fry for another minute. Add the rice, soy sauces, sugar and pepper. Stir-fry until well combined. Divide among serving plates and top with fried eggs, if using, and spring onion.
